text:
"Crime and Punishment"

"Maybe this will be the end? But how did Porfiry come in so quietly, like a cat, without me hearing anything? Was he listening at the door?"

"You didn't expect a visitor, Rodion Romanovitch," Porfiry said with a laugh. "I've wanted to stop by for a while; I was passing by and thought, why not drop in for five minutes? Are you going out? I won't keep you long. Just let me have one cigarette."

"Sit down, Porfiry Petrovitch, sit down." Raskolnikov offered his visitor a seat with such a happy and friendly look that he would have been surprised if he could see it.

The final moment had come; everything was about to be revealed! Sometimes a person can feel scared for half an hour with a robber, but when the knife is finally at their throat, they don't feel fear anymore.

Raskolnikov sat directly across from Porfiry and stared at him without blinking. Porfiry squinted his eyes and started lighting a cigarette.

"Speak, speak," Raskolnikov felt like saying from his heart. "Come on, why don't you say something?"

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov experiences a mix of anticipation and dread as he confronts Porfiry, who unexpectedly visits him.
